column3: Reusing cardboard takes 24% less energy than making it from raw materials!
Recycling plastic saves twice the amount of energy as incinerating it!
Glass is 100% recyclable and can be recycled endlessly without loss in quality or purity!
The amount of wood and paper we throw away each year is enough to heat 50 million homes for 20 years! Wow!
American throw away 25 billion styrofoam coffee cups every year. Uh - oh!
Recycling one aluminum can saves enough energy to run a TV for three hours!
The U.S. scrap recycling industry employs more than 137 thousand people!
Wax paper is not recyclable... So sad!
You also have the option of donating your fabrics.
Cotton is 100% recyclabe and can also be reused if taken to a donation site!
Polyester is the most recycled plastic in the U.S and worldwide!
Some fun and creative tin can recycling ideas in your home include pen and stationery holders and herb planters!
One ceramic coffee mug alone in a truckload of glass is enough to contaminate the entire load and cause it to be rejected from recycling! Keep ceramics out of your recycling bin!
Iron is one of the world's most recycled materials and among the easiest materials to recprocess.
Some foam recycling drop off locations are emerging around the world!
You can recycle your tires if you drop them off at a facility!
Some leather can also be reconstituted at local facilities.
Nike grinds up worn-out athletic shoes to make sports surfaces!
You can sell your scrap metal to make some extra money!
Recycling copper as opposed to processing new copper saves 85-90% of energy!
Steel takes up to 100 years to fully degrade in a landfill. So make sure to recycle!
Recycling bronze is very efficient and saves a lot of energy!
Nearly 100 percent of textiles and clothing are recyclable!
Wood shavings and small amounts of wood can also be composted!
Pyrex cannot be recycled due to its high melting point!
Mirrors cannot be recycled due to their high melting points!
Place the bandaid in a plastic bag before disposal to be safe.
Place the bandage in a plastic bag before disposal to be safe.
Place the medication in a plastic bag before disposal to be safe.
Paint can damage the soil and groundwater if improperly disposed of. There are drop-off sites that accept paint cans!
Dye can damage the soil and groundwater if improperly disposed of.
You can make a lot of money recycling/selling unwanted jewelry!
The ink cartridge inside markers is not recyclable.
Only 12.5% of E-Waste is recycled! Take your e-waste to a local e-waste disposal!
